howstuffworks® | lifestyle May 24, 2007
RSS
 
 How "Gracie" Works  How far would you go to achieve a dream? Inspired by real
events in the lives of actors Elisabeth and Andrew Shue and directed by the Academy
Award-winning director of "An Inconvenient Truth," "Gracie" tells the
story of a teenage girl's struggle to play soccer at a time when there were no
female soccer leagues. Watch exclusive behind-the-scenes videos of "Gracie" and
meet its cast and crew.
Also at HowStuffWorks
 
How Soccer 
Works - Soccer, "the 
beautiful game," has been captivating fans for more than 100 years. Hundreds of 
millions of people watch the World Cup, the greatest spectacle for the world's 
most popular sport. In this article, learn some of soccer's rich history, the 
rules of the game and how soccer is enjoyed in other 
countries.


 

How Sudoku Works - If you've been in a book store in the last six months -- or
an airport, waiting room or college lecture class -- you've probably seen
someone staring at a sudoku. The sudoku fad doesn't seem to be waning. Find out
the history of this surprisingly addictive math puzzle and how it works.
 

How Movie Download Services Work - Until recently, downloading movies usually meant breaking
copyright laws. But in the past year a spate of services has appeared offering
movie download services. In this article, learn how movie download services
work and find the right service for you.
   
This Week's Video
 How PlayStation 3 Works - The PS3 boasts an incredible microprocessor, a brand-new
graphics processor and what may be some of the most phenomenal on-screen images
ever. In this video from HowStuffWorks, learn all about PlayStation 3 and check
out its incredible graphics.
